question: A rise in SENSEX in India indicates which of the following?
option1: There is a rise in the prices of shares of all companies registered with Bombay Stock exchange
option2: There is a rise in the prices of shares of all companies registered with National Stock Exchange
option3: There is an overall rise in the prices of a group of shares in BSE
option4: There is an overall rise in the prices of a group of shares in NSE
answer: There is an overall rise in the prices of a group of shares in BSE
explanation: A share market Index shows how a specified portfolio of share prices is moving in order to give an indication of market trends. The BSE SENSEX is a free-float market capitalization-weighted stock market index of 30 well-established and financially sound companies listed on Bombay Stock Exchange.
